variants.Description in input context: C-terminal deletions (implied by 'C-terminal deletions' in the abstract) and four N-terminal missense mutations in the UBL domain (implied by 'four N-terminal missense mutations in the UBL domain')

Material used.Material Source: Human brain extracts and cultured cells
Material used.Description: The study characterizes mutants using human brain extracts and cultured cells (implied by 'characterize mutants' and 'proteasome degradation' in the abstract)

Experiment Method.Readout type: Quantitative (protein stability, proteasome degradation) and Qualitative (aggregation, 42 kDa species identification)

Readout description.Result Description: C-terminal deletions lead to protein instability and aggregation. Four N-terminal UBL missense mutations reduce proteasome degradation efficiency. A 42 kDa parkin species is identified in the absence of the C-terminal domain.
